Wish these had fit! I think they are more like a 28.

THESE ARE NOT SIZE 27! I wear a size 27 in Levi's and BDG jeans. I wear size 26 in Anthro and Madewell jeans. I could barely get these over my hips and fastening even one button is just not happening. No stretch, maybe men's sizing?, perfect if you've got Kendall Jenner's physique

Vintage 501s vary a lot in fit. These were perfect for me. They did stretch out a bit so I wished I could have ordered a size smaller in this same pant. But the 28 was still okay. They made my butt look great and had really nice coloring and fade

i wanted to love this one, i really did. i thought itd be a cute top to wear to a beach party on vacation. when it arrived, one of the straps was misaligned on the leaf compared to the other side. the material also wasn't as flowy as i'd expected, and the back of it was longer than I would have liked

I loved this top, it got lots of stares and compliments.

Paired this with vintage denim biker length shorts, acetate hoop earrings, and clogs. Just wish I had this outfit earlier in the summer, I would have worn it for every occasion!!
This top was so cute it just didn’t end up working for me

nondescript
Fits a little tight but in a good way. If you are between sizes I would go one size up.

Loved these jeans. Super soft and comfortable. Were definitely ankle pants and tapered at the ends. Worked great with ankle booties.
This brand I always order a size up and I love their jeans!! They fit great and hit right above the ankle
I was so happy with these jeans that I bought them. They're a great everyday staple that I wear with all sorts of tops and accessories.
Loved these jeans so much. Very soft and comfortable and flattering. I’m short so they fit more like regular length on me. But they are a keeper.
Stretchy and soft, flattering jeans
These were a nice wash and cute fit. Just a little tighter than I'd like and not quite long enough for me (I'm 5' 9").
Super comfortable and just well made. I wore them so many times! I may end up buying eventually. Loved them.

I was doubtful to get jeans as part of this, but I am SO happy I did. These were soft, fit well and didn't stretch at all. I loved these. I felt like they made my butt look great and I could tell they were expensive 😂
These jeans for perfectly for anyone who is a little curvy but has shorter legs. Favorite pair of jeans for spring /summer.

These jeans were very cute and comfy. I did read a few reviews saying that they were on the tighter size, so I did decide to go one size up and I'm happy I did. They are tight without being uncomfortable. I love the cropped length.
Loved the wash, great fit and length. I almost kept them but decided to keep another pair instead. I would get these again.
These were very comfortable, the amount of stretch in the denim was just right! THey fir true to size and looked very nice dressed up or down! I will likely re-rent or buy these at some point.
Ran small

I loveeee these jeans! They are so versatile and a confidence booster! I wore them every weekend I had them. They look great with some chunky sneakers or with some loafers. tbh I wish I could buy them.

I loved these jeans. Went on a big snug and stretched just the right amount. Good weight for winter. Hit right at ankle - perfect for boots or sneakers. Was debating buying but renting darker wash first. Will likely rent again.
They fit really well. Had a nice stretch to them and really maintained their shape well!
I would purchase these if they weren’t so dang expensive. Really solid pair of jeans with enough flex to be comfortable but not enough to sag throughout the day
I really wanted to love these, but unfortunately the zipper would not go past a certain point and I could never wear them.

Great fit! I'm tall with a long torso so it's hard to wear jumpers/bibs/etc. These fit great and the straps are adjustable. The rise was flattering but I do wish they were longer in length. I really am debating keeping them!

links_reviews_title: PLEASE FIX THE ZIPPER AND THE STRAPS!
links_reviews_text: These are SO stinking cute but I basically needed to pin myself in for it to work. The straps are too long and the zipper is impossible. I had to use PLIERS to pull it up and down. Please fix this, would have purchased these without all the glitches.
I really liked these overalls. Like the other reviews mentioned, the straps do fall down a bit but they are adjustable and they didn't bother me that much. This is super cute and unique!
This are very cute. The only thing is, since I am taller I have a longer torso. Overalls a lot of the time will go right up my butt and these definitely did. I should have gone a size up.
These overalls are a head turner! I'm 5'3 and typically an XS, 25 petite so I was worried the straps on these would be too long, but they were perfect! The length of the pant hit perfectly as well.
so cute but staps always fall down
cute idea, comfortable but the pants go up my crack with the straps on because I am either too curvy or tall 5'6+
These were the best, fit really nicely and were super cute. wore to work, out to drinks, and to thanksgiving with the family. 10/10 would recomend

Super trendy and cute! For me since I am short and have big boobs the look wasn't quite right, it kind of looked like my boobs were at my waist with how the fit was on me. I also couldn't get the straps to stay up well while I was sitting. They were fun to try, but I wouldn't purchase.
I absolutely love the way these fit. Really versatile, too. My favorite so far.

All of my jeans are size 26, but these were extremely tight in that same size so I would say they run small. However, I'm taller than average with a very long torso, and even then with the straps shortened as much as possible, they were too long and had to keep being readjusted. I could only wear these twice for a couple of hours because they were not comfortable. I did get lots of compliments and I'm glad I tried them because they're unique, but I should have listened to the reviews about the awkward fit.

Okay if I had sized up I think I actually would have worn these multiple times! I ended up criss crossing the straps in the back because I have a short torso and the straps stayed up really well like that! I just had a major camel toe because they were a little too tight for me! Paired with a sweater like the picture but definitely wanted to try some other tops with it!

It was cute on, but the zipper was impossible for me to zip without assistance. It wasn't snug, just the placement was extremely hard to reach, but highly visible if left unzipped. Overall, I was just too short for it.

Got a lot of compliments on this piece. Loved the ruffles. The straps seem to be a bit wide-set as the strap kept sliding off my arm and I consider myself to be fairly broad shouldered. Also, the zipper kept sticking.

Okay I love the style of these overalls. I love the hidden buttons on the straps. The length was good with my height. However the zipper was the bane of my clothing existence. It is a side zip but it doesn't have a button to help hold it together. Which is annoying. It also gets stuck on the thickest part of the jean and won't budge past that bunch of fabric. It fit. Was comfortable on. I just could not get that d*** zipper past that last inch of thick waistband.

i love these overalls. expected them to be large and they were but still cute on! the straps were very very long but i crisscrossed them in the back and that helped! the length was also a bit long on me, wish they came in petite so they would be more cropped like the photo. i wore with a turtleneck cute and mod looking. once with a t-shirt and chucks for more casual. great item will order again!

links_reviews_title: Cozy and cute - can dress up or down!
links_reviews_text: I knew I would love this sweater! It was SO soft and cozy. It is very versatile, as you can dress it up or down. I love the detail on the sleeves, they kind of puff at the top and then are tighter on your forearm/wrist. Definitely more of a crop sweater, so I would recommend wearing with high-waist skirts/pants.

This was a great outfit builder - looked great with every top I paired it with. My only complaint is that the zipper is a little sticky, as they have a thick seam right in the middle of where you pull it up.
This was super cute for dinner out with friends and a casual happy hour. Everywhere I wore it I received multiple compliments!

I really wanted to love these overalls, but I think they're just really hard to fit. I found the pants themselves to run a little large, and the straps kept sliding off even when they were on the tightest setting. The zipper didn't zip all the way up on mine, so that was a bummer. I didn't love the fit of these. I couldn't get the straps to lay quite right. Wouldn't recommend.

I received a ton of compliments on this item! I will definitely wear them again before the month is up. They fit like a glove. I deducted a star bc the straps were kind of annoying to keep up but definitely worth the rental
Cute pants but ran a little bit large and the suspender part kept falling down so I was never able to wear it
Straps just didn't work for me. This fit in the waist but the straps were too loose and wouldn't stay up

These overalls are adorable. I wore them with a graphic tee and black leather booties. My only issue is that the straps are a tad long (and I have a long torso), and they slipped off every time I bent over or shrugged my shoulders.

This ran true to my jeans size. I sometimes can do a 27 if its stretch denim but the 28 fit like a glove. The ruffle straps kinda fall down if you don't have good posture but for a work day it was perfect! I would get this in your box, no question

links_reviews_title: Looks great with a blouse or T!
links_reviews_text: True to size- run long for those with short legs but pair with high shoes and they are adorable!

These just feel like they have a lot going on. It takes awhile to get the right fit with the adjustable buttons on the straps and the side zip, and then the legs flare some and the suspenders have those ruffles. Certainly quite a statement and probably not something I would buy. Sort of a heavy look overall.

I loved the straps on these overalls but like almost all overalls out there, they are too long. This problem is easily fixed by knotting the straps at a certain point in the back then choosing what length the button should go in. The waist was a little bit too big for me but am a true 25 in brands like Mother and rag and bone but more of a 24 in Pilcro.

I was really excited to get these in my Nuuly. I had seen them on the Anthropologie site previously and considered buying them. The pants portion for perfectly but the strap were too long. I had them on the tightest button but they were still too long. I wish they had more button holes for someone with a shorter torso like me. Otherwise they would have been perfect.

links_reviews_title: So cute, with a fatal flaw
links_reviews_text: Loved the feel of these leggings - they’re warm, cozy, and suede-like. The downfall is that the waistband is only sewn in 4 places, so it rolls and becomes uncomfortable/weird looking whenever you sit down or bend.
They were worn and the elastic in the waist was out of shape. Cute pants, tho!

links_reviews_title: So cute, but a little toasty
links_reviews_text: I would have loved these had it been colder. They were great, though I realized I didn't have much in my wardrobe to match with it - so probably should have taken that into consideration. If they were in a different color, might consider them for next winter.
I have been trying to find leggings that I can wear to work and these definitely hit the mark! I paired it with the Kali poncho sweater and received several compliments throughout the day.
This fun spin on classic lines and neutral color paired well a variety of looks. I don't always feel comfortable in leggings, but these worked well on my petite, pregnant pear shape.
These pants elevate every outfit to the next level. Why wear jeans when you can wear something more comfortable? Considering keeping these. I will definitely rent again.
So comfy, super soft. Love the zipper detail at the ankle. Fit is a bit large but not to the point you can't wear them.

These got switched in when another item wasn't available. I was nervous looking at reviews, but they worked fine. I sized up and was thankful for that. These are great but I had read that I may want to size up so I did and totally regret it. Just wasn’t as flattering as I imagined and think it had to do with sizing up.

links_reviews_title: Love the material, color and pant as a whole. Got lots of compliments on them! Just a little big which was a bummer as I would have kept them.

Great to have in my closet for a few weeks - got a lot of wear in and a lot of compliments!

i am glad I sized up

I wore these to work a lot! Bought them!

These are so easy to wear!

links_reviews_title: Onboard with everyone else - pass on this item

i didn’t love the way these looked in person

Loved it, wore it multiple times in my rental period. Considering purchasing!
Comfortable coat

links_reviews_title: Love it so much - so cozy, fluffy, fun to run around in and feel a little glamorous!

Love this coat and got tons of compliments! At times it was hard to take myself seriously when wearing it, but you know what? That’s okay!

This fit really well. I felt beautiful and comfortable. Loved it with high waisted jeans. I have a long torso. And high waisted was the best way to style it. Would be gorgeous with a high waisted skirt too!
This was a great date night top. The shoulders were a little snug when I wore a jacket over it but overall it was a great top!
I loved this top. Almost bought it but nuuly only takes 20% off. The material allows for this top to be dress up or dress down. I might get it again on my next nuuly.
The fabric is a little weird on this top. I wanted to love it, but it didn't look great on me and wouldn't stay tucked in due to the slick consistency of the fabric.

Tried this on with a bunch of outfits and couldn't make it work with anything. The frills are a lot more exaggerated than they are in the picture and unless you're going for a ~lewk~ than I wouldn't recommend.
I love this top. It didn't ride up like some off the shoulder tops do, and I got so many compliments when wearing it.
Love this off the shoulder top. I haven’t worn it out yet but I’m sure I will get many compliments. ; )

This is a pretty shirt but it doesn’t fit like it shows on the model. The sleeves had to be down showing a lot of shoulder. It wasn’t work appropriate and it was too fancy to wear around on the weekends, especially as the temperatures fell.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful lightweight material, stretch and comfy
links_reviews_text: Love the off the shoulder look, it fit well for the most part. The fit of the shirt was true to size, and great around the bust. The shoulders were a little on the snug side but I'm sure had I gone up a size the lower half of the shirt would not have fit right. It may be because the material of the shirt is stretchy but the shoulders are more on the structured side. I paired it with a mini skirt and knee high boots for the pumpkin patch this year!

The shoulders fit me and they didn't move around or slide up at all, which sometimes happens with off the shoulder shirts. I only wore this once though because the actual shirt was slightly too big. Even tucked it it looked too loose and baggy.

This shirt is so pretty. I didn’t realize it was ribbed. Unfortunately it was too big on me. It might have been due to the fact that I have a very small chest but the shoulder opening was really floppy and the hanger strings couldn’t be tucked in.
I wanted to like this more than I did. The colors are more muted/muddy than in the photo, which felt a little dated.
This shirt was a bit boxy the thin material made it extremely static-y Overall I liked it
Very cute and wanted to love it- however its cut really boxy and short! Tried to pair with leggings and didnt work! also tried to pair with a skirt - rode up all day!
I was really excited about this plaid top, but it was too short to stay tucked in (as shown on model). The print is also muddier/darker than it appears in the photo
Cheap, thin fabric. Way small. I normally wear a 14/L in tops and this L fit like a small.
picked this up to wear under a blazer and it's a very cute accent.

I am petite with broad shoulders, so short sleeves shirts can be funky on me, but this fit very well. For someone who also gets warm and likes to layer, I loved the cooler, light fabric, great for under a cardigan. Really happy with this top!

links_reviews_title: Great shirt for fall in warmer climates
links_reviews_text: I loved this shirt, I would have kept it if it was cheaper.

Wore this one with charcoal trousers and a shall-type sweater to work and got lots of compliments. The fabric is soft and warm, like a heavy silk . . . I rally liked how it draped and complimented my sweater.
Loved this one! It fit well and the fabric was a comfortable, dressy weight. It has a slight sheen to it.
Felt like a Cool Girl in this, especially when paired with the right accessories. Veers into PJ territory when worn plain, tho. I'm 5'4" and the size I got was just right!
Easy peasy and bright. This dress I threw on around the house, wore to take my kids for a walk, threw on with cute white sneakers and a denim jacket to run errands. I liked it a lot.
The slit is surprisingly sexy, to balance out the boxy tshirt look. I loved this dress!

I wanted to love this dress so bad but it did nothing for my figure. If you have any type of curves this just hugs you in the wrong places and makes you look like a giant box. The slit helps but I’d size up if you’re not a total twig.

I really loved this dress, and I probably would’ve bought it but the one I got in my nuuly was a little “dye heavy” compared to the one in the picture. I wore this several times, paired with several different sneakers, a clear belt, and a fanny pack once too. Perfect dress for when it’s warm out and you want something easy to throw on and and comfortable! Loved that it was longer so when the wind blew, I didn’t have to worry about the dress flying up. Also as mentioned before, the material is a little heavier but I didn’t mind that at all.

I loved this t-shirt dress, super cute and comfy to wear as loungewear on warmer days. Would also be a cute beach dress! If you are worried about the slit coming up too high and have bigger hips, I would maybe size up. I got a Medium, because it's more oversized, but the slit is very high on my leg since it is a bit tight on my hips.

I wore this dress constantly. It’s super cute with sneakers and if anything else a cardigan. I also wore it belted with a cropped sweater over it so it looked like a skirt. I wish I would’ve bought it, will probably rent again.
wore this out for a 70's theme party and also while im chillin' wfh. super comfy and runs a little big so would suggest sizing down :)

links_reviews_title: cutest dress and the slit makes it
links_reviews_text: so cute!!! the slit really changes it and makes it so unique. it’s a bit heavier than I thought but it worked so well and was so comfy
I LOVED this dress. It's super bright so it's an eyecatcher. Very 90's edgy, got lots of compliments!
A great throw on and go piece. Got it to war on vacation in mexico and it was perfect for the cooler nights without having to wear a jacket.
I really liked this dress, it was like a long t shirt dress but it has a slit so it is still flattering. It's very bright but i really liked it even though i mostly wear neutrals.
i wanted to love this but it wasn't soft...and i just didn't have a reason to wear it.

links_reviews_title: Cute concept but BEWARE terrible colors
links_reviews_text: The colors were extremely disappointing - the picture looks yellow/pink/blue but the one that came in my order looked almost like someone took the caps off a bunch of permanent markers and threw it all in the wash together...just more icky than fun. I wore it to get groceries but never felt cute in it. I would have loved/probably purchased this if the neckline hadn't been so high and the colors had been as pictured.

Very thick material so it was too hot to wear in Atlanta in September. Also very boxy and did nothing for my figure. Probably shouldn't have ordered a large but I usually have to size up in dresses because I am so tall.

Ugh, I love this t-shirt dress! It's so fun and comfy - I was very tempted to purchase and may end up renting again in the future. It fit true to size and was made of a thick t-shirt material. I verge on the short side (5'3") and the length fell perfectly. I wore it to Disney (with spanx underneath to avoid chaffing) and it was perfect to run around in all day!
Absolutely loved this dress, great fit and good length! The spilt is high, so beware if you prefer modesty.

I wore this dress to Austin City Limits and it was perfect! Threw on a jean jacket with it and dr. martens and I was good to go! I probably could've worn this to other things as well, but I got it specifically to wear to ACL and it was perfect!
This dress is VERY boxy. I am not a small girl so this wasn't super flattering on me but I still really liked it! Very thick material. Very bright. Fun to change it up,
This dress was really TIE DYE FOR! It was the perfect fit and felt very comfortable in the dress! I would 100% recommend!

links_reviews_title: One of my favorite things I've Nuulyed so far!
links_reviews_text: Really thick, high quality fabric! A lot less drapey than your average t-shirt dress. I wanted this to be oversized so I sized up to a Large. It still wasn't quite as enormous as I wanted it to be, but it looked cute! I received compliments everywhere I went. When I told people that it was Urban Outfitters, they were so surprised because it seems like it should be so much more expensive. I wore this with a denim jacket and Doc Martens on a cool day, sandals and a wide brim hat on a warm day. I think you could layer it with tights or heavy socks if you want to rock it through fall.
very elegant!
thought it would be a nice Saturday work dress but the material was too thin and just felt cheap and like a t shirt. never wore
I must have ordered the wrong size. The small was too tight and not in a good way.

Was excited to see an Amour Vert dress as I usually love their stuff. Unfortunately, this dress seemed over-washed--the black color was a bit faded, which pointed out the thin t-shirt material of the dress. Also didn't appreciate how fitted the waist/hips of the dress were going to be! Probably should've sized up for a better fit, but not sure that would have been flattering either. Also, the top was just awkward.
This item felt low-quality, thin material - more like a jersey t-shirt dress. It lacked structure. The mock turtle neck hung off my neck in a strange way. Wouldn't recommend.
It fit well on my body but way too tight on the stomach.
It fit well. Fabric was thinner than expected, not as "special" as I'd hoped.
Simple and elegant, great for work
Fit like a glove. I'll be purchasing this dress. Stretchy, but durable material. Didn't feel cheap.
I really liked this dress, but it's a bit sexy for work and a bit safe for anything fancier. I wore it to a work event and was comfy. It fit well despite my larger hips and small shoulders
I really wanted to like this dress but it just didn't fit well around the neck or hips. Fabric was not flattering.

links_reviews_title: Not flattering for all body types
links_reviews_text: I didn’t end up wearing this dress, because it showed every lump and curve.
Form fitting and the neckline is unusual and striking. Great dress that can be dressed up or down.

I really wanted to like this dress but it was just a little too small for my curvy figure. There is kind of a ruching/draping across the top part of the dress which is actually a separate piece of fabric that is attached to the buttons on the back of the neck. No matter how I tried arranging it, it just always seemed to look out of place.
Got many compliments, the dress fit like a glove. Great little black dress with a twist.

This does look cute on and is hella flattering. That being said, the seams near the armpits really itched me for some reason. Never wore it because didn’t have the opportunity but I can imagine if I had there would have been some chafing :-(

I wore this to wine country and got so many compliments on the fun twist in the back. My mom saw me wearing it from the front with a jacket and thought it looked a little old-lady, until I showed her the shoulders and back. Wore the dress with white sneakers and a denim jacket and it was a perfect daytime dress!
Loved and will wear again!
This dress fit perfectly and was so pretty! Loved it!
Absolutely love this dress, the back is such a nice unexpected touch. Perfect for date nights or just a fun night out with friends!

links_reviews_title: Lovely dress, fit was too big
links_reviews_text: I couldn't tell what size to order based on other reviews - I ordered a small, thinking it might be on the snug side, and it was actually too big so it wasn't as flattering. In case helpful to others, I'm 5'10", 140 lbs, usually size 4 in dresses and pants.
Unflattering shoulders.

I loved this dress! I initially didn’t even notice the back cut out detail when I ordered it so it was a pleasant surprise when I received it. I tend not to go for backless options because I’m busty and I don’t like going bra-less but I happened to be going on a girls weekend and just thought eff it I’ll go braless with the girls. And it looked sooo good! It wasn’t sheer at all/couldn’t see my nips through the fabric and I got so many compliments!
Gorgeous dress however runs big. Lots of compliments.
This dress is absolutely gorgeous!!!!!!! Sexy and beautiful. If say size runs pretty true!!!

Loved the back details of this dress and the slit. Light enough material to keep me cool in the afternoon and warm in the evening with its sleeves. I received many compliments and would highly recommend the dress! I wore with white, simple heeled sandals! Hair down, bright lips and black earrings. Honestly, it’s a must!
Loved it, snug and stretchy mini dress. Was comfortable for a tight dress.
Flattering and form fitting. I was hoping to tape the girls in but the double sided tape wouldn’t adhere to the fabric. Wore it out dancing n Miami and had no problems.

links_reviews_title: great dress for a wedding shower!
links_reviews_text: very flattering fit
Deep cut wasn't too revealing, but the material was a little thin. Great for a hot day.

links_reviews_title: Very low cut but flattering everywhere else
links_reviews_text: I really liked the cut and sleeves of this dress but it was reallyyyy low cut. I was uncomfortable about something popping out the entire time I was wearing it. If you are okay with wearing a bra under, go for it!

links_reviews_title: Very pretty, maybe just not for me
links_reviews_text: I wore this with a cami underneath as I’m pretty busty (if you’re more than a b/c, you’ll probably have to do the same). I’ve been losing weight but still sometimes in between sizes and I definitely ordered a size too big. I’ll try this again as a medium and see what it’s like!

The buttons are very hard to work (something that I complain about only because I need to constantly be unbuttoning to nurse my baby). It is VERY deep v, had a hard time wearing a bra with it. Puffed sleeves are cute & slit isn't too high. Material made it feel more casual than dressy.

This dress was really cute and true to size. I wore it to my family's Christmas Eve Party. I wear a DD Bra so it is a little low cut for women with larger tops. It fit really well and the length was perfect. I would purchase for future events for sure.

I wore this dress to a benefit a little before Christmas. I paired it with patent black mary jane heels, white fluffy dangle earrings and a long black puffy jacket. The front of the dress is a little deeper than I expected, but I felt so comfortable and confident the whole night! I would definitely recommend this dress to anyone who was considering adding it to their nuuly!

I loved this dress so much. It was the perfect combo of dressy and casual with a nice touch of sex appeal and was exactly what I was looking for to wear to a fancy dinner while I was on vacation. Unfortunately I got sick and wasn't able to wear it. I was so disappointed. I will say that I sized down based on previous reviews and was very glad I did. As it was I would have needed to sit up very straight at dinner to keep the girls in.
Fit great, was a material that was just heavy enough and the detail in the pattern was nice

I actually really liked this dress! It was very flattering for pear shaped body types! I almost purchased it, but it was missing one button when I received it and another fell off while I had it, so I wondered how well it would hold up. Very cute though!

This dress is so flattering and very beautiful. I love it so much, I’m considering buying it. The only negative is that you’re unable to wear a bra because the neckline goes pretty low. Unlike the other review, I think this dress runs pretty true to size. For reference, I have an hourglass shape and this dress fits me very well.

I love this dress and print, but it’s not right for my straight body type. There is a lot of curve in the hips, so I think it’s best suited for someone with great curves. If you are between a small and a medium, I recommend the small, as the medium was very big on me.

links_reviews_title: Loved the style not the fit
links_reviews_text: This dress is cut differently... got my normal size but was too large in the busy and waist. Fabric did not sit right on my hips.... did not wear

Very pretty fabric, very revealing in the bust, surprisingly. I thought the leg slit would be more intense, but it’s the neckline that’s showing a lot. Probably easier to wear if you’re less curvy, the ruching at the waist is a little challenging for curves.

I wanted so badly to love this dress. I loved the fall colors and print; however, the fit of this dress was just impossible. The neckline was plunging and extremely wide. I do have a large chest, however, I am not certain this could be appropriate on a smaller chested body type either. Additionally, the ruching in front gave a strange, unflattering appearance.

I wanted to love this dress, the small floral pattern is so cute and I love the color. However, it is too tight in the places I don't want it to be (my stomach and hips) and too loose in the top half. The neckline came down way lower for me than in the photo and was gaping open. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to wear it because of the fit issues.

loved this dress - lightweight, great colors, loved the cutout sides and slit in the skirt. zero bust support which wasn't an issue for me but could be for others. wore to a beach rehearsal dinner party.

links_reviews_title: Surprised this worked for a small shortie
links_reviews_text: I'm quite small on top, but I was pleasantly surprised it looked great on, haha! Similar to another reviewer, there was something a little off with the metal V on top that caused it to lay a little asymmetrical after some time, requiring some adjusting to correct it. Luckily, this got worn to a dinner without a ton of movement, but I could see that being pretty annoying when dancing or otherwise moving ones arms around, hah. Have to dock a couple of stars since worrying about your outfit is not fun. But the color and fit is so pretty!
Didn't end of wearing because it ran big and very tough to wear a bra with! The bottom also has a weird flare to it that wasn't very flattering.

I got this to try for an upcoming wedding, but it wasn’t what I expected. The top fit great, but the bottom was very loose, which made the dress very revealing for a wedding. It might work if you pin it, but I didn’t want to be worrying about it all night and it still would have been a lot of torso showing. Nice fabric, great colors. Maybe could work as a beach dress.

I picked this dress to hopefully wear for a friends wedding in the Caribbean. The dress fit perfectly! I paired it with tanned heels and fun earrings. Received a lot of compliments throughout the night. I was able to wear the dress without a bra and the metal supports were enough.

links_reviews_title: I got tons of compliments with this dress. It was comfortable and stylish. This is one that I would rent again.
links_reviews_text: I wore this with some wedges and let the dress do the rest. The particular dress I rented had a bit of a defect from the v wiring in the bodice, but nothing too serious. This is such a great dress for the beach or a sunny day.

Wore this to a holiday dinner party and received so many compliments. Loved the color of this dress and also thought it was really flattering on- the side cut outs were cute but wished found myself pulling it up sometimes because it was just a tad big but other than that, it fit perfectly.

This dress was fun but the material is thin so it does not hide lumps or bumps well. This would be best for a small chest, my C cups could have used a bit more support from the top. I wore this to a rehearsal dinner on the beach and it was perfect for the occasion but I would probably not wear it again.

I was intrigued by the cut of the dress but couldn’t wear it out because there wasn’t enough coverage in the chest area. Maybe I should’ve gotten a smaller size? I’m usually a small but in order for the torso to be snug maybe XSmall would’ve done the trick.
Super cute, it’s a nice cotton blend that looks casual but also put together. Wore with high waisted jeans cause it’s a little cropped. This is the best pic I got yelling at my kid on Mother’s Day
Too short and runs small, couldn’t wear it.

links_reviews_title: More structured than it looks in photos
links_reviews_text: The linen fabric of this top was super thick and sturdy. I was successfully able to wear it without a bra and didn't worry about any nipple visibility.
This shirt was super starched and hard to wear. Was not comfortable and didn't look good when I tried it on.
Perfect for vacation, it's so cute and feminine. It's a more structured feel than you might think. I wore in the evening at our resort while vacationing in Mexico and got numerous compliments.
Very fun top and I thought it fit true to size; it’s linen and doesn’t stretch, but was just right for me. I loved the one decorative shoulder, it felt special!

This top was so cute and I wanted to wear it so badly. I am a true X Small / Small with no boobs and I could not get this blouse to zipper over the side of my rib cage. When I rent this again in the future I am going to have to size up to a small or medium.
rented for vacation and paired with white pants - fit well

links_reviews_title: Love this dressed up or casual
links_reviews_text: Super cute dress, I am 5 ft 2" and the length was just fine.

I LOVE THIS DRESS and wish I could buy it!! It felt amazing to wear a dress I could not afford. I had to wear a black one-piece underneath to cover my nipples which will be exposed otherwise LOL! A bandeau would work too! The dress is amazing and I love how the buttons stop right above your knees so you can still show some leg.

In addition to the fit being too small on the waist, the lining in the skirt did not cover my butt and the top is unlined. I kept trying to find a way to wear it... maybe if I had a black slip. Also, the material looked worn/faded, which is never a good look on black. Almost as if it's been washed too many times. I really wanted to like it, but it was a miss for me...
Cute dress - better for warmer weather

links_reviews_title: Cute in theory but texture threw me off
links_reviews_text: This is the one item of my order that felt extremely worn and torn.
This dress fits well and is beautifully tailored. I wore it many times and styled it differently or with a jeans, blazer or just as a dress.

links_reviews_title: Almost wonderful, but ultimately not for short girls
links_reviews_text: I so wanted to love this dress! But, I'm short (5'3") and even in heels, the XS felt too long and baggy. It felt more costumey than like an actual dress. I bet it'd be gorgeous on a taller woman, but sadly, not for me.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress- very versatile and always a hit
links_reviews_text: Wore this dress a lot in the month I had it in all different settings and was always a hit! I has subtle peek-a-boo and sheer layers that are very flattering and balance the coverage of the dress. I would recommend wearing a straight neck bandeau bra to highlight the lace along the bust. I think I would have purchased if it wasn't so expensive but will rent again. Highly recommended!!

I absolutely loved this dress! I don’t have much of a waist and it was extremely flattering, giving me the illusion of an hour glass figure. It is lace in the bodice so you need to wear it with a slip, black camisole or black bra so that you can’t see your chest. I got so many compliments on it and highly recommend it! I’m fairly tall and slim and the XS was perfect. I think it would be tricky to fit anyone who is on the shorter side though.
I am normally an xs or s in a lot of free people so was not expecting this love shack fancy to be SO tight, I could not button it on. Sigh-

links_reviews_title: Loved this dress! Flattering, casual, cute.
links_reviews_text: Loved wearing this dress! I assumed the fabric would have been nicer given the retail cost, to be honest. It’s cotton. Catches a ton of lint and wrinkles. Needed to be steamed/iron before each wear. Style is beautiful though. Received lots of compliments on it. Would totally rent it again.
Pretty dress but the whole thing is see through.

I love this brand and this dress did not disappoint. This dress works with leggings and a layered tank for cool weather. The fabric is thin and the lace has many appropriately placed elements see through elements.. which means it would also work for summer. The XS waist is tiny, but there is lots of room on the bottom, which works for my body type.
great fit, very versatile, paired well with sneakers and heels
Just a bit too long, while the neck was a bit too high for my liking. Felt too covered up. Good if you're looking for a conservative dress.
I’m a solid 4 & would typically size up in designer dresses if anything. Based on reviews I got an XS & it was perfect. Easy to wear & dress up or down.
I selected an xs for this dress (I’m either xs or s) and it fit perfectly. I really like this dress and would gladly buy it if it weren’t so expensive. I would rent this dress again.
Pretty dress, pretty details but didn't work for my short, curvy body. The bust was way too lousy and the waist way too tight.
I nullied this to attend a dia de los muertos dinner. It was perfect. The lace detail is gorgeous. The fabric is not my favorite, picks up everything and it's visible on the black.

Was expecting the buzzy line to really deliver, but this dress was just okay. The fit was okay, but I didn't feel like the dress was at all worth the money. The construction is average: there weren't thoughtful stopgaps to the buttons gaping like some shirtdresses have. The fabric was very nice and soft so I understand this would add to the total cost... but this is in item I'm so glad I could rent and test-run. I would not buy this. I really thought loveshack quality would have been higher!
This dress is absolutely beautiful. I would say that it runs a tad large. I got the medium and it fit nicely with a little room in it! Normally I wear Medium or Large.

This dress runs LARGE. I had to pin the waist in by probably 3-4 inches and use the double sided tape to make this look normal. However, it's very comfortable and looked great once I adjusted the waist. Would rent again!
I LOVED this dress- paired it with brown sandals and a Lele Cheetah Headband :) Planning to wear this one, one more time with black heeled booties for fall!
Beautiful dress. The torso is really long and the tummy area was really tight. Wanted to love this, but it didn't fit my body type.

Loved this dress - nice cotton material, can dress up or down. But, order a size down, it runs very large and has an elastic waist. Also, the top is completely see through and you can't wear with a normal bra; but works okay with a black tank or bralette.

Got this dress for a warm weather vacation and loved it! Probably would’ve gotten a S but they were out of stock but I just couldn’t pass it up. Hemline does run a little short on the side where it has a slight short hem detail.
VERY short dress, and I'm a short person.

Like other reviewers have mentioned, this dress is SHORT. I'm a short girl 5'3" and am fine with showing lots of leg but this was super short. I mostly wore it with tights and booties but wore it bare-legged once when I was feeling brave.
I had so much hope for this dress but the ruffles are too much and it's ridiculously short. I'm 5'1 and I just felt like I could not pull off the length for any occasion.
It’s really fun but short!! Know your audience. It is a lot of ruffles but it’s fun and playful.

I thought I was going to love this dress but I put it on and was very underwhelmed. The frills are just too much. They didn't lay right and I steamed the dress before wearing it. I won't be renting or wearing this dress again.

I thought this dress was really cute, but keep in mind that I'm short! I really don't know how someone who is taller than 5'5" would be able to wear it and not reveal a whole lot to everyone!! The top is looser and the layers do add some bulk to you but not unflattering, just noticeable. I did belt it and it needed it to break up all the cream color.

Got sooo many compliments on this dress! Had my eye on a Loveshack dress for so long which is why I wanted to rent and see how it fit. I got tons of compliments and it fit really well. A littlleeee see through but tan undergarments were fine. It was a bit short in the front and I'm a super short girl so TALL GIRLS BE CAREFUL! So cute with sneakers or even wedges.
Super cute dress, but be warned it is SUPER short. I wanted to wear it but I felt I didn't have anywhere that was appropriate to wear the dress.

I only got to wear this dress once, in fear of spilling something on it, but I wish I would have just worn it more!! I love all the ruffles on this dress. I styled it with a long cardigan and a belt. Make it note that it is VERY short!
I so wanted to love this dress, but it was way too frilly for me.
Im 5'4 and the XS was maybe an itsy bit too short- i put shorts underneath and wore it with sneakers. Got alot of compliments but would have chosen the SMALL if it was available for length!

links_reviews_title: Too much fabric and I never say that
links_reviews_text: I got this dress to possibly wear to my bridal shower and when I tried it on I laughed out loud. There is so much fabric I felt like Little Bo peep. I am someone who can pull off a lot of drama but this was drama and all the wrong places. Had great potential but definitely didn’t follow through and didn’t weird at all.
I wanted to love and wear this dress, but it was just way too short on me. I have a longer torso, but this dress barely covered my bottom half. It fit everywhere else though, just way too short!

I have a bigger chest but the shoulders were still really large for me sadly. A really cute style but a bit big for my body (just too much fabric). The photo isn't great because I never ironed it since I wasn't wearing it out but I hope it helps with sizing!

The dress looked very cute on photos, but when put on, it is very frilly and puffy, it does not fit as well as the modeled photo which was a bummer. I tried ironing it to make it flatter, but nothing really worked. The chest area is also quite loose, so I would recommend pinning the chest pieces together because it opens up as you move around.
The dress does not lay nearly as flat as pictured; it fit well but it was very poofy -- it was a little more "extra" than I had anticipated. Beautiful quality, though!

Loved the special embroidery details, but I felt like I was swimming in this dress, too much material for my taste. And it didn’t quite cinch up small enough around the waist. I think I would have liked this more if it came in the full range of alpha sizes.

This dress is so pretty. It fit me a bit large on the chest and waist area, but you are able to tie it around to make fit. It’s a bit short even though I’m 5’3, but I didn’t mind it. I felt very feminine in it.

I was so excited for this dress. I normally wear larges in dresses so I expected this to work and if anything be too snug / short. I was swallowed in fabric. It was way too big. This can normally be helped with a tie around the waist, like advertised on the model. I'm not a big pattern person, particularly on the bodice, so I topped it with a thin black v-neck sweater and wore with leggings and booties. It looked super cute.

But later I wore it with tights when it finally hit me that the tunic is actually really long, and people said "Pretty dress." The colors are not the most flattering for me personally, and I will avoid the brown/warm tones in the future. But the top is very nice regardless, and I enjoyed wearing it.

Great colors and pattern. Pretty and professional, which made it great for the office. The small was pretty big on me—it definitely fit more like a dress than a tunic and hit just above the knee. The waistline dips down in the back, which I wasn’t expecting, but it worked somehow! Looked great with tights and a pair of boots but I’d like to buy this as it’s a thin material and would be great with sandals for the summer too.
Love the variances in the fabric; but it was pretty ho-hum on. I wore it with brown Spanx leggings as a tunic. It was okay. Not something I'd rotate.
Fabric didn't breathe very well...but cute fit and great print/pattern mix

Love this tunic, although I’d consider it more of a dress. I’m 5’9” and it hit right at the top of my knees. Runs a little big, I’m normally a small but got an XS which fit perfectly. It’s very flattering and versatile. The fabric feels great and it comes with a black knit slip to wear underneath. Seriously thinking about buying it!
I got many compliments and it was really comfortable. It helped hide my bump and you could barely tell that I was pregnant.
I like this because I could definitely wear during pregnancy and after! Wore in Cancun and it was elegant, comfy but loose enough for maternity wear. Colours are pretty. Probably runs large
I liked this piece a lot. It is great for the office without looking stuffy or boring.
I really liked this tunic, there was a lot of fabric so it looked frumpy without a belt.

Got compliments. Pattern is great. Feels comfortable. The drop back butt thing fell a little low on me and I think made my butt look big. The tank top was a pain...I’d wear your own tank top or maybe just a nude bra. Not buying, though was fun twice.

I liked this and got a lot of compliments. Its a shift dress so it didn't do much for my body but I would wear it with and without tights and it was appropriate length for office but fun for happy hour. Good fall piece.

I wore this with black tights and knee high black boots. Good length, to the knee, to be worn as a dress. Comes with black slip to wear underneath. Very comfortable and material and print are very pretty with black, mustard and olive colors.
Great everyday dress and will transition to fall nicely with boots and tights. Runs roomy, can sized down if I’m between sizes. Regular size works for petites well. Sleeve length is perfect.

I loved wearing this. Definitely was a dress and not a tunic. Did not fit like the picture shows, but I liked it anyway. It runs big for sure. It felt like wearing a nightgown but looked cute. I wore it with taupe suede knee high boots.
I wore it as a dress in Arizona in October with a light cardigan. Fabric is soft and travels well. I really liked the colors and the print. I recommend!

This dress has a lovely Fall print but the cut was not flattering on me from behind. For some reason the waist seam goes down in the back so the dress fits oddly (see picture). I really wanted it to work for me but had to send it back without wearing.

this was a unique piece that was very cute on. Very soft woven material. Came with a long cami to wear underneath. I"m 5'2" - so worked as a dress on me - but could also be cute as a tunic with leggings/jeans.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress, but not a top
links_reviews_text: This is a beautiful tunic dress, its flowy and surprisingly flattering. I subtracted a star because I expected it to be a tunic top based on the first picture, and it falls below my knees. The cut is also very wide, I got a L because I wear a 12 in pants and wanted to be sure it would fit my hips

Super soft, comfy and got lots of compliments when I wore this. I ended up purchasing because I wanted to keep wearing it. I’m 5’4 and 118lbs and got a XS. I can wear this as a dress since I’m shorter. Will look good with leggings and boots for fall and winter.
Even though I'm tall, this tunic was too long on me. It came down to my knees, more like a dress. Very pretty fabric however!
I wore this with jeans and over leggings. Super cute. Cut higher in front lower in back. Very roomy. Cute, vibrant print. Could have probably fit into XS.
Wore this to work with a black belt and black cropped leggings. Without a belt, it's boxy but still really cute.

I love a wrap dress, and this one just fit so well and was such a fun print. I loved the yellow, black and brown color combo, and it just fit super well everywhere. If you love wrap dresses you’ll love this.
I want to love this dress but it looked somehow a little, dumpy? On me. I’m tall and very curvy. Maybe on a thinner/less curvy build it would be cute.

This dress does not seem to have any kind of fastener on the inside, so if you walk a little too briskly your whole leg is exposed. I needed to safety pin the dress so I wouldn't have an oopsie at work!
If I could wear this dress everyday I would! So comfortable and fabulous!

links_reviews_title: cute, but I swam in it!
links_reviews_text: way too big unfortunately!

I actually thought this would be a perfect dress for Halloween. I went as Cher, from Clueless as a 38 year old single mom. Haha. It worked. But for real life, not my style and seemed to Little House on the Prairie for me.
This dress was form fitting yet comfortable. I liked it a lot.
I loved this dress but it made my hips look massive. Would be flattering with someone with a much straighter build

I got this dress because it looked like I’d be able to breastfeed in it. And boy could I have! Haha. It just didn’t fit me at all in the busy area. I could barely get it closed and when I did half of my breasts was showing. It was also a little longer than I had hoped. I don’t think I could have sized up as it fit perfectly everywhere else. The fabric was comfortable and the pattern was great.

links_reviews_title: Very cute dress and colors but weird fit
links_reviews_text: This is a wrap dress, so I was expecting to love it. The neckline/shoulders did not fit me very well, so I didn't wear this one. I'm also on the shorter side, so this would probably be better if you are taller. Very cute pattern and colors for fall/winter!

This dress is ok. In person, the style was a bit too 'prairie' for my taste. I also had a lot of problems with the wrap skirt, which kept opening too much when walking or sitting (even with adding a safety pin). I found it to be true to size, and I wore my usual size medium. I liked the midi length.
Comfortable dress; perfect for fall! Wore with congac booties.
I wore it to work but it did not really fit well. It made me feel too frumpy.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful shape of a dress, but too small for the ladies!
links_reviews_text: This is really a beautiful dress, especially the way the skirt drapes with the fabric and design. But sadly, I can't wear it without revealing my chest, or wearing a camisole underneath, which adds bulk.
I got a Large but could have gotten a Medium. I had to roll up the sleeves but still looked great. Got lots of compliments

Cute dress but it needs to fit properly; otherwise looks like you’re swimming in a plaid yellow blanket. Definitely size down; also might require tank underneath (or tape) as the chest area was loose and flops open when you sit

links_reviews_title: Wrap dress that didn't wrap around enough
links_reviews_text: The dress was flattering but it fell open to my hip when I sat down and I had to hold it shut when I walked. I styled it with boots just like the picture but in black. I wore my usual Anthropologie size small. I am 5'8' 130 lbs with a 27" waist 37" hips. I wore it to work. I don't think I would wear it anywhere else.

links_reviews_title: Finally, a wrap dress that fits
links_reviews_text: I absolutely loved the fit of this dress, I just wish it was in a different print. I always have issues with the tops of wrap dresses gaping open, but this stayed closed. Also loved the little collar and the ruffle at the bottom. The yellow and brown plaid might look awesome on someone cooler, but it made me feel dowdy. Fabric is also on the thicker side, so probably a good cool weather dress.

This was cute little dress but instead of wrapping the dress around i knotted it in the front and then wrapped it. It gave more of a high-low hemline and added a little detail to the front and allowed me to wrap the dress tighter that designed. I styled with white sock boots and received lits of compliment. By daughter borrowed it, knotted it as well and styled it with combat boots. Super cute just needed a bit of help.

This was very comfortable dress with pockets. It's pretty long so it works better if you are taller (I'm 5ft 8in and it was ok). Only complaint is that it's a wrap dress that totally flies open if there is a slight breeze.
Loved this dress. Gorgeous material! Wish I could've worn it more, but it was unseasonably warm this month. Love the detail on the sleeve.. got plenty of compliments the first day I wore it.
Very cute dress! I love the midi style and I was able to wear it on a warm day with the sleeves rolled up.

links_reviews_title: Great fall dress, just too big on me
links_reviews_text: I really wish this fit me because it's really beautiful. The pattern and beading scream fall in a good way. The arms were way to roomy and even when I tried to tighten it (it's a wrap dress) the back got all bunchy. It definitely looked like the dress was wearing me, not the other way around. I like it so much that I'm thinking of getting it again, just sizing down.

links_reviews_title: Adorable, but did not look right on me
links_reviews_text: This dress is sooo cute, but it did not look right on me. The XS fit, but made me look really flat chested and the neckline hit in an odd place.

It's great to find a lightweight dress with sleeves, perfect for summer work events. Really fun modern print - something a little bit different than most of my wardrobe. I can see this getting a lot of use!

Although I'm not going out much right now - this dress looked chic and professional on Zoom calls for work and also for dinner with my son when I'm channeling being out again. I'm tall and it hung perfectly as well as wasn't too short.
Loved this dress! Perfect for a breezy quarantine day.

Dress it up or down, but always be comfy. Got this just in time for the global pandemic, so didn't get to dress it up a lot myself. It was great for working from home - leggings on the bottom, the nice fitted top with some big earrings looked great for zoom meetings. The cut of the shoulders and neckline are really flattering. I did find it quite snug up top, so if you have bigger shoulders or chest, you might want to think about sizing up?
Loved this dress. The fit on it was a true shift dress. Unique pattern. Easy to dress up or down.

links_reviews_title: cute but didn’t end up fitting the season
links_reviews_text: I liked this dress and would have been an easy transition to maternity dress ... the long sleeves just didn’t line up with the weather while I had the dress.

This dress is soooo cute! I really got my money's worth out of it. In the picture, the line where the pattern changes is straight across- this was not how it fit me, most likely because I am quite a bit bustier than the model, and it wasn't bad, but just be aware that it will be more diagonal if you have any boobs. I wore this to work, to dinner, casual hang out- it was easily able to be dressed up or down. I will order again!
Loved the print and lots of room for growing belly (~20 weeks) - can see this working further in pregnancy, but didn't buy since dress appeared faded already IMO.

This dress is super soft and felt very nice on. I didn’t wear it much as it was a bit too dressy for me (stay at home parent). I would have worn this a HEAP if I had an office job. A very much ‘one and done’ outfit that looks tidy and is super comfy.

Went with the reviews for this and it ended up being too small and too short. I am 5’2” and it came to mid thigh on me ... don’t know how it would be possible for a taller person to wear this as a dress.

I got XXSP and fit pretty true to size, Slightly tight underarms, but a size bigger overall would have been too big. Wish it had pockets and probably would have kept it. Fun with tights and booties or spring with sandals.

Wore this to work- perfect for the office for my 28 week bump, you could see a hint of a bump without it being too figure hugging. Pattern is pretty and flattering, this can easily be dressed up or down.

Cute, comfortable and easy to wear. I am usually a small/medium but I tried this in the store before I ordered it and felt that the XS looked the best. Although the small would have been fine also. The place it would tend to be tight is the back. Waist and hip area is generous.
This is pretty, just not for me and it was too tight on top, so should have gone with PXL.
I got tons of compliments and I loved how it looked on me. If you have a big bust, either pick your normal size or size up.

links_reviews_title: Nice but short and hasn’t worn well
links_reviews_text: I have been watching this dress for a while as I have it in other prints. But this was a disappointment as it was too short and felt like it shrunk after the last wash. Colors are faded and not as crisp as I wanted

links_reviews_title: Just a tiny bit short for work
links_reviews_text: The print was lovely, the fabric was comfortable, but it did ride up a little short in the front. A little too short for work with bare legs. For reference I'm 5'8''.

The dress is sweet and comfortable but having had children and many a maternity dress, the high waist brought back too many flashbacks. I think it’s more of a mental thing but however I styled I just couldn’t make it work for me.

This fabric is nice, it's also comfortable and soft. Cute pattern, easy to dress up and dress down. I wore it to Thanksgiving and it's super forgiving when you eat a big meal! I also wore it to work a couple of times, sometimes with boots and other times with a jacket and heels to dress it up for work. Versatile and fun piece!
Super cute and easy dress for work or play, definitely a keeper.
Shouldn’t have ordered this its not really my style, it was too long, over the knee and just fit like a potatoe sack. Not flattering.
I enjoyed wearing this flowy printed dress. It has a flattering fit because the fabric drapes nicely.

I loved this dress, I wore it to work with tights and knee high boots. I am normally a SP but many of the reviews suggested sizing down so I got an XSP and it was a little snug all over. I will definitely consider renting this dress again, but stick to my true size.

Really like this one -- enough that I bought it! I'm a size 12/curvy 38D and this dress looked cute on me. It has enough shape to cut in under the bust/at the waist a bit and not look tent-ish. I wore it 3 or 4 times with black tights and black booties and got many compliments each time. Would be great in warmer weather as well. Winner!

links_reviews_title: Great transitional dress if you're into getting compliments
links_reviews_text: I absolutely loved this dress and received compliments on it every time I wore it, which was a lot during my month. The silhouette and fabric make it a great for transitional weather – I wore during the fall styled with over-the-knee boots, but I think it'd look great with sandals or booties in warmer weather. The neckline was an inch or so too low for me, but nothing a well-placed safety pin couldn't fix.
I wore this with knee high boots. Love the fit and the print. I will wear this spring, summer or fall due to the light weight fabric and 3/4 sleeves.

It may be my own fault for ordering the petite, but this was shorter than I had anticipated. I planned to wear it to work, and it showed more leg than I thought Office appropriate. I did wear tights which helped! It wasn’t hoochie short, just not quite professional. Otherwise sizing was good! I’m a solid small, But I ordered an xs thinking this might be baggier in style, and I was right! Fit well, flattering, cute empire waist style. Would totally buy if it were on sale and not a petite.

This fit me perfectly and is great for petite sizes. It drapes beautifully- it’s just a touch longer in the back and it hangs in such a way that it is comfortable and roomy but doesn’t look like you’re wearing a bag. The pattern is understated and classy. It doesn’t have as much pizzazz as other items on here but looks good on and is versatile. Great for workwear or weekend.
Super cute dress. Got lots of compliments. Loved it
Easy to throw on dress up or down. It’s very forgiving and yet flattering at the same time. I got so many compliments I wore it again and again!
This was a cute enough dress, pretty oversized and the colors weren't as saturated as they appear in the photo.
The material was a little thin so probably better for fall or spring (not winter). Also doesn’t have a ton of shape so I styled with a belt a few times.
I wore this dress a few times, although the fabric is pretty light so it’s better for warmer fall days. Super soft and comfy, though.
This dress is so confortable and flirty at the same time, love the texture, it is so soft...
Very flattering on a larger bust, forgiving in the wait line.
Wore this while traveling and it was super comfortable while also being cute. A bit too casual for my office, but could definitely get a lot of wears out of it on weekends.

Wore this with knee high tan boots and people stopped me to complement and ask where I got it. It’s loose enough to be comfortable and swingy but still super flattering. Bought it immediately and highly recommend.

links_reviews_title: Love this dress. many complements. perfect for work
links_reviews_text: so cute with brown booties
Super comfortable and easy to throw on with a pair of sandals or booties!

Such a great every day dress! It's comfortably boxy and the perfect length for a petite person. You can easily wear this dress in all seasons: with sandals in the summer & booties and tights in colder weather.
This was an adorable print and could be dressed up or down. I struggled a little with the neckline. I wore it with a cami and without because depending on the bra it either showed cleave or not.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for the office at 25 weeks pregnant
links_reviews_text: I loved this dress. It was so comfortable, did not wrinkle too bad while wearing and was the perfect length for the office. I was 23-26 weeks pregnant when I wore this dress and after reading reviews on both Nuuly and Anthropologie I ordered my pre-pregnancy size XS. Pre-pregnancy I am 5'4 105 pounds and currently I am closer to 130. I think the XS would have been a little hangy on me pre-pregnancy, but I still would wear it. Just know that it is loose-fitting at the waist. Very flattering for all shapes.

This dress fit perfectly even for a mama to be - easy to put on and fits/cinches right above the tummy for maximum comfort. Light enough for warm weather but easily layers with leggings. Highly recommend.
Cute dress, wish it had pockets.

links_reviews_title: I got compliments every time I wore it!
links_reviews_text: Super cute, versatile dress. I wore it dressed up a bit for a board meeting, with added jewelry and some mules but also felt comfortable throwing it on for running errands.
Such an easy to wear dress for work or a casual night out. Wore several times!
May have to buy it :)

links_reviews_title: Very cute - Loose and Flowy Goodness
links_reviews_text: The sizing on this is very forgiving, given its loose styling. I was able to get away with an XS (all available at the time) and it fit fine, albeit a tad snug in the arms/shoulders. I'd have done better with a small, but this was still a great piece for work. Styled it with some wedge booties and a long cardigan and got lots of compliments!
I wore it with pumps to meeting.
This was a really nice dress -especially for early fall. The dress ran a little big so I wore a belt with it to keep is from looking a little like a sack.

links_reviews_title: Adorable swing dress - works for tall girls
links_reviews_text: Love this dress! The pattern is fun and different and it fits great. I'm 5'11 and the medium came down just above my knee, which I like. I wore this to work with low pumps and casually with flat sandals!

Got this in medium but should have gotten it in small. Such a cute dress irl. I only wore it a few times even though I love this dress because I didn't want it to seem like it's the only thing I have in my closet. :)

Love this dress, I ordered a large because I have larger boobs and most M dresses don't fit me. But this dress in a L is definitely too flowy. It is super comfortable so I just wore it with a belt the couple of times I did wear it throughout the month.

This dress is so adorable! It's a great piece for work, but also cute for going out to dinner or out on the weekend. I ordered a S petite and the fit was perfect - length was great, and I had a little room in the waist area which was nice. The pattern and material are really nice and the dress is very versatile! I wore it with navy/purple mules and it was perfect for work.
Got lots of compliments! Easy, breezy dress. Dress up or down

Although the pattern is great, this dress made me look like I was poorly wrapped in a colorful gift bag. I tried it on, folded it and placed it right back in the shipping bag. If you're tall, have at it. If you're short, run away.

Cute dress— got some compliments on it :) heads up though it’s not the cotton-y fabric it might appear like in the images, it’s more synthetic than that. Also if you’re in between sizes maybe size down due to the oversized cut of the dress.
good quality, cute for work, to tight on chest
LOVE this dress. It is so flattering and the perfect length. I am about 5'8ish and it hit right about where it hits on the model. The print is also super cute. I got a ton of compliments on this one.
Oversized but super cool. I only wore a few times, though. It's a great weight for cool early spring/fall days. I would rent again.
Wore this a lot. Great spring jacket! It’s more oversized than it looks! Super comfy and loved the terra-cotta color!
It’s perfect,, warm soft and trendy you’ll want to keep it
Color was a bit more rusty orange in person. Not too oversized & super warm!

links_reviews_title: Taylor Swift Wore This, Therefore I Rented It
links_reviews_text: Definitely an oversize jacket. It's like wearing a comfy quilted blanket. I ordered a small (I'm usually a small or medium) and am glad I didn't get the M. I would like it a little more fitted in the body, but I think the sleeves of an XS would be too short for me (5'9). I love wearing it but not enough to purchase.

links_reviews_title: Loved the style, too big and droopy
links_reviews_text: I loved the idea, but it ran big. Not sure it’s worth trying a smaller size as it has no shape in the shoulders so it’s pretty droopy and the material is heavy. I thought my broad shoulders could make that work but it just looked sloppy for me, since I’m already pretty casual.
Probably the best coat I have ever worn. Looks good dressed up, dressed down, literally great with every outfit. Obsessed.
super cute jacket. was the perfect weight for transitioning into warmer weather. loved it!

links_reviews_title: Comfy jacket in an great color
links_reviews_text: This was a solid jacket. Loved the color, it was interesting enough to add interest to an outfit but also was neutral enough that it worked with a lot of things I already wear. The sleeves are SO long though. I'm really tall and I still had to roll them, which isnt super comfortable to wear and makes it look grungier than it should. It also felt way more "worn" than other items in my nuuly.
Pretty warm, fits loose but well. Vintage washed look. Wore this in NYC during the winter and was content with the warmness. Would def rent again
AHH!! Loved this so much

I am absolutely in love with this knit jacket! It's the perfect throw on to dress up or dress down. Very cool and casual. It's lightweight so I was wearing in the 50-degree Carolina weather and it was perfect. The color is a really cool rusty brown and goes with most items!
Super warm. Got so many compliments. Wore it almost every day of the month.
Really enjoyed this jacket! Was a really cute color and looked great with everything. This did run a little large but you could tell it was part of the look. Very comfy and wore it all the time!

At first I was skeptical of it but decided to just walk out with it and I loved it. Its rustic and vintage like style had everyone ask about it. It is a little large but not so big where it doesn’t work.

Tried it n and never took it off the rest of the month. I usually am a Medium- Large in jackets and I went with the small and it was perfect! I could layer, but also felt like it wasn’t swallowing me!!! Such an incredible piece!!!

links_reviews_title: obsessed ended up buying! rented twice!
links_reviews_text: best jacket
Loved the color and the fabric found it to be wayyy too big. I wasn't able to wear it sadly.
I wore this again and again - it is *so comfortable* and *so cute*. I got compliments every time I wore it and was sad to send it back!!

I am obsessed with this jacket. I wore it so many times and am going to rent it again next month. It is a little oversize but that’s why I sized down from S to XS. It is so soft and I LOVE the color. It’s super easy to layer and is very versatile.

Loved this jacket, I wore it in LA and New York over the holidays and got countless compliments on the oversized fit. I would definitely recommend sizing down since it's already an oversized look - aside from that, would 100% recommend!
Love this jacket and I want to keep it! Will definitely order again if possible. It's so soft and warm. This is a sweatshirt-like material, so it's not good in the rain/snow.

Seriously the best item I've gotten from Nuuly. It was stylish for going out on Saturday night, yet could still be worn to class Monday morning. SUPER COMFY AND CUTE. I dressed it up, and I dressed it down and got a million compliments both ways. Will probably rent again
wore this a ton. baggy oversized fit was great and actually warm! great color, received lots of compliments on it.

OBSESSED. I had to buy it! Everywhere I wore it, someone gave me a compliment. Heavier than I thought it would be. It kept this Florida girl plenty warm on vacation in the Grand Canyon over Thanksgiving!
I loved this coat but it was not warm enough for the PNW in the late fall/early winter.
I wish I'd bought this! I truly wore it almost every day. It's actually fairly warm, especially with a thick sweater under it. It's also oversized, which is a great look.

links_reviews_title: Best jacket I've gotten on Nuuly
links_reviews_text: I loveeeed this jacket! Wore it so many times over the month, and I got a million compliments. It was the perfect over-sized look without being bulky. And I actually loved the weight of the jacket - felt comfy like a weighted blanket! I didn't get it in this month's Nuuly, but I've been thinking about it so much I think I'll get it next month and end up purchasing. Great staple that adds color without being so in-your-face.
I should've sized down - the only thing that kept me from the perfect jacket. So cozy, but unique enough to be part of the look on its own.
A must rent!
This is adorable but it was just too cold in Michigan for it this month! Would love to try again maybe towards the spring time!
Loved it so I bought it.

I had eyed this jacket in stores for sooo long I thought I'd try renting before I committed and I'm glad I did! I would definitely order down a size because the "oversized"ness of this jacket can make it look a bit like you're wearing your dads work coat if not styled or fit right. But super cute and comfy casual

links_reviews_title: Oversized but in the coziest kind of way
links_reviews_text: Great fall color. Noted that this fits “large” but mainly because it is oversized. I could have gone with an XS probably, but the S was great too, just rolled up the sleeves a bit to make it look more styled.

This jacket truly freaking rules. I took this on a 6-City work trip and wore it every single day. The dolman sleeves make it perfect for layering over bulkier winter sweaters but still don’t overwhelm the silhouette. It is very warm but still lightweight, and has a beautiful, rich color while still being relatively neutral and easy to pair with anything. It is the best. It honestly pains me to send it back, I love it so much!!!!
So comfortable! Not to mention it’s so cute on. It runs big, but I like it baggy with the sleeves rolled. A must keep!

The fit of this jacket is so slouchy. It's def a look. One time when I wore it, I had a twin, which I don't really like! I think since I'm tall, the slouch just hits me differently and looks awkward. Also, I am fair skinned and I felt this color washed me out a bit. I still wore this jacket a lot. There's something undeniably cool about it.

This jacket is everything. So unique and got SO many compliments.. goes with so much for the fall season (over jeans, workout clothes, etc). Can't recommend enough! Definitely runs on the larger side, but it's purposeful.
I think I wore this every day I had it and think I might have to make money moves on this baby! So many compliments
This jacket is a straight up cloud. I used it as a pillow on the plane on my trip and did not take it off all week long. I love it so much. And the color was perfect for fall!!!

I love this jacket, I've ordered it twice. It is oversized and so comfortable. You can wear it with anything. I love to dress it down and wear it with jeans and a t-shirt. One of my favorite coats to just throw on as it's so comfortable! Wish I could afford to buy it!

You need this jacket. While I runs big, you’ll be happy it does because it fits over everything and is just warm enough for fall transitional weather. Wore with jeans, leggings, and work clothes and would purchase if it weren’t so pricey.
I got so many compliment on this jacket. Loved it
I loved this jacket. Perfect for the middle of fall - super cute but surprisingly warm

This had the perfect weight, warmth, fit for a fall jacket. The color was perfect for fall and not normally something I would try out so this was a happy surprise. Loved wearing this so much - definitely recommend!

One of my favorite pieces I've rented so far. The material was so comfortable and loved the color as well. Similar to other reviewers, I wanted to buy it but it was a bit over what I ideally wanted to spend. Definitely recommend renting though!

links_reviews_title: Very comfy quilted jacket, fit well and keeps you warm!
links_reviews_text: Really like this jacket and quilting, might select it in another color in the future! Highly recommend!
