links_reviews_title: Quality material, flattering, comfortable wrap dress
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress to church and got a few compliments. This dress is nicer than my average Sunday dress, but it's still "me", so no one was surprised to see me wearing this style. My husband did say "it looks like my mom made it", referring to his mother's quilting hobby... But husbands don't know anything. The wrap was very easy to do, with a thick strip of the same material as the dress for wrapping it. It is a true wrap dress, meaning it opens completely up in the front. Something you look for in a wrap dress is a secure fit - you don't want it opening up on you! This dress was very secure, with the strap to wrap around, along with a very discreet snap closure. The side that flaps on top to close the dress did a bit of a sliding thing - where the inner material would flip a bit and display the not-so-pretty cream colored lining of the dress. That's my only complaint. The dress drapes and floats beautifully, and I would even consider renting it again!
Very cute, has some shimmer to it. I have a smaller bust and was surprised to find it to be a bit low cut and tight in the bust.

links_reviews_title: One of my favorite Nuuly pieces!
links_reviews_text: This dress just makes me feel pretty! I followed other’s suggestions and sized up one size....i am also usually a petite, but o think this length works fine.

This was a very pretty dress for fall, looked especially nice with boots. Only issue was that there was nooooo way it would close the way it looked in the photo on me. Not a big deal, I just wore a camisole underneath, but just fyi on sizing. From the waist down it fit fine and tts.
Wore this to a Thanksgiving dinner with family and it was the perfect amount of vintage charm with Fall colors! The clasp for the chest wasn't strong as the fabric is light.
This dress is really cute and I wanted to love it, but my 39" bust needed at least three more inches of fabric for the size large to fit. Would be great for someone who is smaller on top.

This dress looks how it does in the photos and has some nice metallic-y thread details up close. It's a little fitted in the wrap part and is a bit thicker of a material there. I definitely should have sized up (I'm usually a 4-6/S and I got this in a small) but it runs more like junior sizing and I think I wold have been more comfortable in a M. The top part didn't really close all the way (I'm not big busted--about a 36A/34B) so fidgeting with that was a bit annoying which is why I only wore it once. Would try again in the right size!
I styled this piece almost exactly like the model, with knee high boots and I was in love. I would totally and rent this again I felt like a retro goddess in it. Fit true to size!

links_reviews_title: It’s really cute but it runs small, it would say the large would fit a 10 not a 12.
links_reviews_text: Too small in the bust and waist.

links_reviews_title: Cute to dress up or dress down
links_reviews_text: This dress is super cute. I wish there wasn't a cut out in the back though as i had to wear a coat with it at work.
I wore this on thanksgiving. It was a fun dress!
Wore to a Friendsgiving and it had just enough give but also fit perfectly!
THis dress looked great and fit well, but didn't have the opportunity to wear it

links_reviews_title: Too tight on top, awkward fir
links_reviews_text: Material felt nice, but back button made top and front feel too tight, color is nice, but dress felt too long for my height. Nice sleeves.

I would need to go up two sizes in this to have any hopes of it fitting. Definitely a style for someone with fewer curves. If you're busty, steer clear. The back and skirt both have fully functional buttons which makes it a little tricky if you tend to fill clothes out more. Slight give in fabric but the buttons can gape. If you have a figure similar to the model, go for it. It's a lovely style. I wish it'd fit.

links_reviews_title: Love the pattern + cut—fabric is a bit thin.
links_reviews_text: I enjoyed the stripe and cut of this piece. I only wore once because of the fabric was a bit too see thru.
I loved the style of this dress but it swallowed me whole! I just couldn't make it look right even with strategic pinning.
You can't go wrong with navy and strips, with a little flare. A bit long on my 5'4 frame, but with heels looked very professional.

links_reviews_title: Easy to Wear but Not Quite the Right Fit
links_reviews_text: I'm not a fan of wearing camisoles under wraps, so this was a miss for me in that regard. Otherwise, I loved the length and ease of the dress. I may rent it again in a size larger and if I keep it, get it tailored.
Size large was too small for me and I wear size 10-12.

links_reviews_title: big at the top and small at the bottom
links_reviews_text: I think this will only look good on if you are super tall and thin (and evenly proportioned)
Just wasn’t a good fit for me, I am short and a dress this length didn’t really flatter me. The top was also very large on me so if I did wear it I would’ve had to wear an undershirt.
Power dressing is made of this. Paired with a white tank top.
Interestingly enough so far this simple piece turned the most heads when I have worn it
This was an elegant work dress- a bit tight by the waist.
Need a tank under for work.

links_reviews_title: Love the dress - had to buy it!
links_reviews_text: Super flattering and comfortable business dress. It was a bit low cut for my office, so I just wore a cami under it and paired it with some pop of color (red boots)

The darts on the rear end were in a weird place, which made it gape in the back too much. Perhaps it would fit better on someone with a shorter torso. Also the V neck wasn't even; it looked off center
this is a great dress. received many compliments. I will say if you are on the busty side you will need to wear a cami underneath, or as i did, wear a scarf.
I agree with prior reviews that this is very low cut. I wore a cami under it so I could wear it for a work event - looked OK that way but obviously not the intended style.
Very nice and flattering dress. Spanx needed so the material lies flat around the tummy area.
Rented this dress for a corporate award ceremony and I had to doctor the front, which was too low for the occasion. Otherwise, this is a lovely dress.
Love the dress but size down as it runs way large.
Loved the silhouette but I wanted to wear it to the office and even with something underneath it was still a little too revealing for work.

Even with the simple navy blue and stripes, this silhouette still stood out at a business outing! I felt sharp, sexy, and sophisticated (and got soooo many compliments). Styled with leopard print pumps and simple gold hoops.

I loved this dress!! I wore it to work with knee high boots. I didn’t think the slits went up too high, but I did size up to a large which may have added some length. Could easily be worn with tights if you are concerned about the side slits. I recommend sizing up. I liked the fabric, but I love in a warm weather climate. Would probably work best in spring and summer.
I wore this dress to work, but I felt like it was for the wrong season. Will consider for spring/summer.
I got a ton of compliments on this dress and ended up buying it. It is an easy to wear style!

This material felt like a potato sack. It is thin and stiff. The slits on the side also came really far up the leg, keeping me from wearing it to work, which is what I chose this for. It was very narrow in the hip area, causing buttons to come undone a couple of times while I wore it. I’m usually between a small and medium, so the medium seemed to be a little tight. Other than that, the colors are nice, and it’s a really nice design. I like the pockets.
Didn’t like the style or fit

I was really excited about this one but the material was awful. I felt like I was wearing a potato sack. It was also pretty tight on my arms and booty so every time i sat down or moved to much the buttons would gape open. Disappointed.
I didn’t love the material or belt, but this was a simple work dress for the month. True to size.
Loved wearing this dress to work meetings. It's a nice "elevated" casual. Great quality, long enough, and kind of chic. It would also look great with a long sweater over it.
Loved this light-weight casual dress; felt polished without having to try. Great for work or day time on the weekends.
Too large, felt like I should be reporting to a factory floor. Usually I love a shirtdress but the colors and cut didn't work on me.
Received a ton of compliments and felt very polished in this dress. The fabric had more structure but was very flattering and felt expensive/well-made.
Very cute and comfortable!
Flattering and cute, tts. The fabric was a little rough feeling.
cute dress for work. nice fabric and fit. wore with black booties. looks cute with flats too.

This dress fit me true to size. I'm typically a size 4 in dresses & the small fit me just right. This dress has a thick material so it wasn't great for the hot month I ended up having & in person, it was just okay (not necessarily a standout dress.) It's very business casual so it ended up being a great dress to wear to work! Very sophisticated & I ended up getting a few compliments on it. Definitely a corporate feel so I wouldn't suggest it for anything outside of a work dress!
Great material, wore it a ton. Just such an easy everyday dress for work or casual. It ran true to size for me.
This little dress was darling! It was slightly big around the chest. However I paired it with a black sweater shrug from Anthropologie. Super cute!

The pattern and length were lovely but the overall dress was too large. Even if sized down, I still feel like it would be too large. There is no cinch at the waist or bust so it sort of just hangs off of your shoulders.
Comically large
Too short for me!

It looked like I was wearing a dark brown bag. The length was way too short to consider wearing as a dress, and I’m only 5’3”. I tried it with leggings but the bulk of the lower part along with the pockets just looked awful.

links_reviews_title: Cute Tunic- not really a dress
links_reviews_text: This was great for the 7 month bump- super soft and cozy, i loved the 3/4 sleeve length and the pockets. It was slightly shorter than i was comfortable with to be worn as a dress but might not have been without a bump pushing it up...i wore with leggings for lounging and running errands and loved it.

I usually love t-shirt dresses but this is really more of a t-shirt haha I'm 5'9 and it definitely was a little too short to wear with tights as a dress. I didn't mind the boxiness of it, just too short for me!! cute on the model tho

This is comfy and has pockets! But unfortunately because it's cotton it's a little tough to wear. It's on the short side of things so without tights or pants its too short. The comfy sweatshirt style doesn't really lend itself to tights and with jeans it feels quite frumpy. Perhaps someone shorter could manage it with some converse and call it a day!
Easy little dress in a great French terry fabric and color.

This dress is just odd. I wanted to like it because of the material, it’s literally like a sweatshirt, but it was super boxy and super short! Granted I am 5,9”, but there is just no way I could wear this as a dress.

I might need to keep this one. Something about this dress makes me magically make a new friend every time I wear it. It’s a lot simple, a little special, perfectly comfortable, and has pockets - who doesn’t want those qualities in a friend or a dress? It’s so easy to wear, I keep going back to it. It isn’t the most stylish or flattering dress ever, but I really do think it puts me at ease enough to be my best self. Does that sound crazy? Oh well!

This is a sweatshirt you can wear out or to the office if styled right! I wore this very pregnant and in my normal size and still had plenty of room. I probably wouldn't wear this as a dress due to the length, but loved it over skinny jeans and leggings. I tend to love styles like this though its not very figure flattering, but if you are adverse to oversized items I would avoid!
I did really like this, but I just didn’t find myself reaching for this piece like I thought I would have. I blame colder then avg weather.

This "dress" was extremely soft and comfortable, but it was super short. I ordered the small since the dress looked baggy, but unfortunately it was too short to wear alone or even with tights. However, I ended up wearing it with my Commando brand leather leggings and it looked great as a tunic top!

You really can't go wrong with this dress. It's super comfy with pockets. Paired with the right shoes, it basically allows you to wear sweats to work. I wore it with a camo button down like the pic and rolled the sleeves.
I didn’t realize this was silk! It lessened the number of times I wore it, because I’m scared of nice things. Fit great and super comfortable! Great addition to my COVID-wear.
Love this jumpsuit - sexy, comfy, so so soft. Only pain is unbuttoning every time you need to use the restroom but to be expected with a jumpsuit.

This was such a cute little outfit. I wasn't sure about it but it was such a unique vibe that my hubby and kiddos loved it. The reviews regarding size were all over the place so I wasn't sure what to do. I selected a large and while it still worked it was a little overwhelming on my frame. I'm usually a 4-6, closer to 6, and I should have stuck with the M. If I order this again and I might, I would choose the M. Fun and easy to wear I styled it with a cute little white hoodie wrapped around my waist and leather hi-tops! In the proper size I'll try heels!
Perfect for working from home. It was comfortable, had a nice subtle pattern, and - best of all - no waistline.
Wore this a lot...super silky, roomy and comfortable. Runs large.

links_reviews_title: Loved the fabric, not the fit
links_reviews_text: This was going to be my luxe WFH outfit. It was wonderful fabric. The jumpsuit had amazing details (cute gold buttons). My TB flats were perfect with this. However, from the bust to the knees was a fit disaster. Granted, it may have been my body, but I’m willing to go out on a limb and say the model may have had some help with pinning to get that beautiful fit. The pant part is a harem style which isn’t evident from the photo. It has potential, just not on my body.

links_reviews_title: A total bust in my opinion.
links_reviews_text: Honestly I wouldn't recommend I ordered a size small and it looked like it was a large or xl. My boyfriend compared it to a flying squirrel or parachute?? I didn't mind it being so big since I rented it to lounge in at home but the fabric is also super see through.

The fabric is much more "pajama-like" in person than what it looks like in the photos. Very soft and luxurious feeling but very thin. Also, I am 5'10" and usually don't have an issue with short jumpsuits. If I do, it's typically just in the crotch. I couldn't even get this up over my arms! It was also SO tight around the ankles and I am slender. For someone who is slender and very petite this would be beautiful in warmer weather.
Love this jumpsuit, but way too pricey to keep. Super comfortable and easy to just throw on and wear.
I would love to rent this again for spring/summer. It was sheerer than I thought it would be. Fabric feels luxurious!

I had a hard time returning this one. Super slick fabric, so comfy. I felt like a big, chic child in this onesie 😜 wore it with a big scrunchie and hair piled on top of head. I wore this MANY times!! It just screams cool.

I'm pretty casual 70% of the time and this was a great jumpsuit. I wore to a baby shower during the day with sneakers and switched shoes for a friend's birthday dinner in the evening and was comfortable all day. Love the gold button details at the ankles too!

This is the most comfortable jumpsuit ever. I wore it with Birks during the day and strappy sandals are night. So many compliments! And so flattering...which is interesting since it doesn’t necessarily have much of a shape. I’ll look forward to ordering it again one day!
It’s is sheer so it’s best to wear something underneath or if you’re just lounging at home then you don’t really need anything. Tons of compliments though!

This piece was slightly big on my frame, so I only wore it around the house while friends were over, but overall still really cute. If I was slightly taller, I think it would have felt less like I was wearing pj's. Super soft and well made.

I loved the fabric and the design, but I ended up not wearing this. For my body type it felt like wearing fancy silky pajamas, even when dressed up with a belt and hat. I think if you are tall and slender this may work for you. It seems like it would be great on a warm vacation somewhere.

Hi, if you want to look cute - rent this. If you want to be cozy - rent this. If you want to look like a milllllllion dollars - rent this. I will buy this one day. And I will rent it when the weather is back. Everyone totally rent this now. Except in a small. Don’t rent it, just in case I need it!
I know they aren't supposed to be, but I wore this as pajamas and it was so comfortable and fun to wear around the house!
This jumpsuit is fire.

I love this jumpsuit. It feels luxurious because it’s silk, but is so comfortable and funky. It’s a perfect Nuuly item because it’s a very memorable item and awesome for a one-time statement outfit. I wore mine with big gold jewelry, flats and a tan shell underneath.

links_reviews_title: I wore this to every Thanksgiving meal
links_reviews_text: This jumpsuit is so fun and so comfy. I wore it to every Thanksgiving and Friendsgiving meal that I went to. It is HUGE. I usually wear a Medium, but ordered an XS after I saw the other reviews and I'm glad I did.
It looks even more out there in person. It was too short so it didn’t drape quite as nice as the pictures of the model or the other users who submit pictures. I’m 5’8”.

links_reviews_title: So cool! But too short for me
links_reviews_text: This is made of beautiful delicate silk that has no stretch. Unfortunately since I'm so tall the ankle cuffs sat at my calves making it impossible to button them. It looked a little silly to wear this with the cuffs unbuttoned so I ended up returning it unworn. Great for anyone 5'6" and under!

I wore this to a gallery opening as well as a wedding, and it was a conversation starter. Only issue is that to take it on or off requires a ton of tiny cheaply-made button work, and/so to go to the bathroom is a chore.

I'd been eyeing this in another pattern from Free People but didn't want to spend the money for something this funky that I wouldn't get much wear out of it...Bottom line is I'm glad I rented it and never actually bought it. It's huge so definitely size down, even if you're like me and don't like your jumpsuits tight. I'm confident when wearing funky things, but sadly I only had events with strangers or work people rather than friends, so it never got worn because I didn't feel it was ever super appropriate (some people just don't appreciate the silky pajamas look). You 100% need heels/wedges to make this look not like a silky trash bag. My friends suggested a belt and I think that would have helped. The button closure isn't super tight so you might give a peek inside if standing/leaning at the right angle. If you think you can rock it and have a reason to wear it, definitely get it.
Haven’t felt this cool in awhile. The buttons are a pain when you need to use the bathroom, but the compliments makeup for it.

This is a very pretty piece, but much more dressy than anticipated - it is a shiny very thin silk material, so not a very casual wear. Also I made the mistake of ordering it during the wrong season. More suited to summer IMO. It runs very large - but it’s very pretty and I wish I’d had the opportunity to wear it.
Super stylish jumpsuit. Really wanted to wear it just never found the right time.

I ordered this as a fashion risk as I like things a bit more form fitting, that being said, the fabric is a dream, it's chic and is like wearing pajamas. I'm 5'3 so it was a bit long and baggy at my ankles. Cute for running errands.

links_reviews_title: Love this outfit and got so many compliments on it!
links_reviews_text: I wore it with open toed shoes but if the weather is chilly there is totally enough room to wear leggings underneath!
I like this a lot. It does have a ton of buttons making bathroom breaks a challenge. My friends also thought I was wearing an adult onesie, so just know it’s not for everyone.
I wore for a night out with some heels. Very comfortable and fun. Not something I’d usually wear but the reviews spoke for themselves !
Cute, baggy fit. I cinched it with a waist belt.
So out of my normal style wheelhouse but had a lot of fun wearing this one. Felt like pajamas, so silky! Only qualm was having to unbutton the whole front and ankles to get out of it.
Love this so much! Will probably buy it or at least rent continuously for the foreseeable future! So comfortable so trendy just overall amazing!
It's a silky, shiny fabric with gold button cuffs at the ankles. I paired it with some gold sandals and jewelry for a 1970's Virginia Slims Ad kind of look. Very unique piece, but I loved wearing it.
I felt like having an adult pajama party in this one. Loved the oversized fit and can be worn with heels or flats depending on the outing.
I loved this look, it’s a statement and is just as pictured.
I liked the way it looked minus the length. It was too long for me but otherwise super cute. I’m 5’5 and the ankles were very bunched.

I. Am. OBSESSED. This jumpsuit looked exactly like the photos, fit perfectly and was SO FREAKING CUTE. I got compliments every time I wore it. If it weren't $495, I'd buy it, but I'm totally going to order it again for my next Nuuly! :)
this is such an unusual piece, but i LOVED it! so cute and comfy- it's like wearing super fashionable pajamas! if they were less expensive, i'd keep this for sure. got lots of compliments- adorable!
I absolutely love this jumper. It's so cozy, flattering, and keeps you cool even on toasty days.

I absolutely love this jumpsuit. It fits me perfectly, I am a bit shorter so the legs are slightly too long but it was not a problem at all since the ankles are tight. The material is silky soft. Unfortunately, it wrinkles pretty easily but is for the most part not very noticeable since it is a very flowy piece. Love lounging around in it at home and I would definitely wear it out again!

The jumpsuit is really cute. Relaxed fit and feels really nice. The downfall is it’s completely see through. Unless you intend on only wearing inside your house or wearing a full catsuit underneath I’d recommend passing.

This top looked super cute and sophisticated on! I really enjoyed wearing it and felt very chic!! I know one of the other comments said it looked cheap, but I felt it was quite the opposite when wearing!
Got so many compliments! Loved this, runs a little big so I got an XS instead of a S and it fit great.
This was a very pretty top. I am a size small and it was quite large on me. I would size down if I ordered again.
The top fit really well and I tucked it into my high wasted jeans. The only problem was both of the buttons on the right sleeve popped off super quick. I only wore this shirt one time.
It looked OK when tucked in, but it was a bit short and ballooned out and wasn't flattering. One of the buttons on the neckline was broken.
I wore this on New Years Eve and receivved a lot of compliments.
This is a beautiful top! It was light and easy and the neckline did not feel too high. Paired it with wife leg black pants and booties.
Love the blue velvet.

Adore the blue velvet, but I wish it was a bit longer so that I could tuck this in without it coming untucked. Worn loose made me feel A bit like I was wearing a maternity top. The sleeves are the loveliest feature, and definitely play homage to old Hollywood glamour. I considered this a possible keeper until the buttons started falling off.

I love this top, it's super versatile but the burnout-velvet like look adds something a bit different and special. Such a great top for fall/winter. and as per usual, tons of compliments! Fits really well, slightly oversized as pictured, I typically wear a L or XL because I prefer looser fits, super cute tucked in or French tucked.
As soon as I put this on all 4 buttons popped right off! I could be believe it!

I wore this to work and got tons of compliments and suggestions that I should wear it to holiday parties. I’m giving it 4 instead of 5 stars because there is a lot of volume so you are required to tuck it in and it is a bit warm and doesn’t breathe much. Good for cold nights

Like some of the other reviews, the buttons fall off really easily. I only wore this once and within the first few hours I'd lost a button on the wrist and off the neck. Luckily I found them on my office floor but I just didn't love the top enough to sew them back on myself to wear again.
loved the way I felt in this. very elegant. I left three of the button on the neck undone and then folded it down. looked great. very classy and feminine

The only things I would tweak is how high the neck is and to definitely size down. It runs large so you'll have to a French tuck to make it look more streamlined. This looks like an expensive top and I decided to throw caution to the wind and wear it with a bralette vs a tank top. It is sheer but the dark color, fabric and flower patterns make it so it's hard to tell unless you're in direct sunlight. One of the button did pop off while i was trying it on but seems like an easy fix and it didn't impact how I could wear the top.
Great top that can be worn at work, and after work for a date! The texture of the fabric is very nice. Best to wear it tucked in though, as it's very voluminous.
